abstract.p: New guidebook by Susan Shumaker and Than Saffel, Vegetarian Walt Disney World and Greater Orlando, contains reviews of over 275 restaurants (S)

block.p: It may be a small world after all, but is it also a meatless one? A new guidebook, ''Vegetarian Walt Disney World and Greater Orlando,'' contains reviews of over 275 restaurants in Disney World, Universal's theme parks and elsewhere. The authors are Susan Shumaker and Than Saffel, writers for Vegetarian Times. The 304-page guide costs $14.95 plus shipping from Vegetarian World Guides; (304) 292-2497.

Cruises typically travel the surface of the ocean. But a 12-day journey out of St. John's, Newfoundland, Aug. 29 to Sept. 9 and Sept. 9 to 20 will also go below the water, 12,460 feet down. Operation Titanic will allow 16 people to take a deep-water submarine to the wreckage of the Titanic. Participants will have two to three hours to view the wreck through seven-inch-thick portholes. The trip is aboard the Akademik Keldysh, a Russian research vessel, and costs $35,500 a person. Call Zegrahm Expeditions; (206) 285-4000.

Some resorts promise the moon; Las Ventanas al Paraiso in Los Cabos, on the tip of Baja California, Mexico, won't go that far, but it will offer a good look at it this summer. Guests in the 61 suites will find telescopes, lunar maps and a chart of the skies over Baja. They can also participate in stargazing evenings Tuesday and Friday with a computerized telescope. Rates through Oct. 15 are $325 to $750 for most suites. Call (888) 767-3966.

The North American distributors of Ducati motorcycles have an interesting test-drive program for the Italian-made bikes. Ducati World Tours, which include such destinations as the Alps, allow participants to ride various Ducatis. Trips are arranged by Lotus Tours, a Chicago motorcycle-tour operator; (312) 649-9007. A tour Oct. 1 to 7 in the Adirondacks, Vermont and New Hampshire, for example, is $2,695 for the driver, $2,195 for a passenger.
